en:
In 2019, Nausica√° will be promoting the Heroes of the Sea!

In connection with this year's Science Festival, the theme of which is "Telling science, imagining the future", Nausica√° is hosting two start-ups that will unveil innovative solutions from nature! üí°üåøüê†

Who are these start-ups? What innovations do they propose? How can they improve our daily lives? So many avenues to explore!

‚û° What if the ingenuity of nature inspired the innovation of the future? üí°üåø
After graduating from business school, Sidney Rostan founded Bioxegy, a pioneering French consultancy and expert in biomimicry.
This novel R&D approach consists of drawing inspiration from the teachings of nature to create intelligent and sustainable innovations. Relying on techniques, functions and properties developed by living species to design and develop bio-inspired technologies for Bioxegy's client companies and partners.
www.biowxegy.com

‚û° The French start-up EEL Energy is developing a new type of tidal turbine. üåäü§ì
The movements of aquatic animals are based on undulations. Eel Energy reproduces the properties of biological systems! A 100% ecological solution!
A huge and renewable resource on a global scale without impact!
Meeting with Franck SYLVAIN, Managing Director
www.eel-energy.fr

Around these innovations, Nausica√° presents its new Open Innovation platform, the "Blue Living Lab". üåèüí°üíª
A real living laboratory, the Blue Living Lab's mission is to support project leaders with citizens, researchers, industrialists and political decision-makers
The objective: to co-construct innovative and sustainable solutions!

See you in Nausica√°, Ocean Performance Hall, on Tuesday, October 8, 2019 at 7 pm
üëâ Free with registration - Limited seating: https://bit.ly/2n2G30D
